Face 2: Front Face Create a new sketch and draw a rectangle on the X-Z plane with the given points: * Line 1: [0.0375, 0.0] to [0.225, 0.0] * Line 2: [0.225, 0.0] to [0.225, 0.0375] * Line 3: [0.225, 0.0375] to [0.0375, 0.0375] * Line 4: [0.0375, 0.0375] to [0.0375, 0.0] Create a closed loop and apply the same scaling factor as the first face. Extrude the sketch by 0.0469 units in both directions. Face 3: Side Face Create a new sketch and draw another rectangle on the Y-Z plane with the given points: * Line 1: [0.0375, 0.7125] to [0.225, 0.7125] * Line 2: [0.225, 0.7125] to [0.225, 0.75] * Line 3: [0.225, 0.75] to [0.0375, 0.75] * Line 4: [0.0375, 0.75] to [0.0375, 0.7125] Close the loop and scale the sketch using a factor of 0.75. Extrude the sketch by 0.0469 units in both directions. Part 2: Creating the Cylindrical Cutout Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered end, resembling a metallic rod or tube. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0857, 0.0562, 0.375] Create a new sketch and draw a circle on the X-Y plane with the given center and radius: * Center: [0.0375, 0.0375] * Radius: 0.0375 Close the loop and scale the sketch using a factor of 0.075. prompt: <description>**Part 1: Creating the Base of the Rectangular Prism** The first part to create is the base of the rectangular prism. It has a flat top and bottom, and will serve as the foundation for the entire assembly. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Using the coordinate system defined above, create the following 2D sketch on face_1: Sketch Details: - Face_1: - Loop_1: - Line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.5] - Line_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.5] - Line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.0] The sketch has a total of 4 lines that form a rectangle. Now, extrude the sketch by defining the following extrusion parameters: Extrusion Details: - Extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.0337 - Extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0 - Sketch_scale: 0.75 - Operation: NewBodyFeatureOperation **Part 2: Creating the Sloped Side** The second part of the assembly will be the sloped side of the rectangular prism. This side smoothly connects to the base and provides the final shape. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties, with respect to the first coordinate system: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0337] Using the second coordinate system, create the following 2D sketch on face_1: Sketch Details: - Face_1: - Loop_1: - Line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0187] - Line_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.0187], End Point [0.0, 0.0187] - Line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0187], End Point [0.0, 0.0] The sketch has a total of 4 lines that form a rectangle, similar to the base, but with a smaller height. Extrude the sketch by defining the following extrusion parameters: Extrusion Details: - Extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.015 - Extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0 - Sketch_scale: 0.75 - Operation: JoinFeatureOperation This concludes the creation of the parametric CAD model based on the given JSON data. The final shape consists of the base with a slightly tapered top and a flat top and bottom (0.75 width and length, 0.0337 height). The sloped side connects to the base (0.75 width and length, 0.015 height).</description>
